definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic

sentences.english: Poetry prophecy is an exotic flower in remote mountains which is in full bloom in our Chinese classics hundred-flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 诗谶是盛开在中国古典文学百花园里的一株深山奇葩。

sentences.english: But he was right about the legislation’s significance.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于这次立法的重要性，他果然是一语成谶。

sentences.english: Augury includes augury word and augury event.
Augury includes augury word and augury event.
The above quoted prophecy recorded in that there are several rumors, compared with a typical children's songs.
sentences.chinese: 上面引录的谶谣中即有数则为典型的童谣。

sentences.english: Dharmaksema is a famous translator in the 5th century in Northern Liang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 昙无谶是公元五世纪初北凉著名的译经大师。

definition: literary auxiliary particle, comes at the beginning of a sentence
variant of 帙[zhi4]/variant of 秩[zhi4]/(classifier) ten years
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
to sigh in regret or pity/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
